summary.long: Colossians is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text: This letter is from Paul, a missionary for Jesus Christ. God wanted me to work for Him. This letter is from brother Timothy also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am writing to you who belong to Christ in the city of Colossae. May all the Christian brothers there have loving-favor and peace from God our Father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We always pray and give thanks to God for you. He is the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We give thanks to God for you because we heard of your faith in Christ Jesus. We thank God for your love for all those who belong to Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We thank God for the hope that is being kept for you in heaven. You first heard about this hope through the Good News which is the Word of Truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Good News came to you the same as it is now going out to all the world. Lives are being changed, just as your life was changed the day you heard the Good News. You understood the truth about God’s loving-kindness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You heard the Good News through our much-loved brother Epaphras who is taking my place. He is a faithful servant of Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He told us that the Holy Spirit had given you much love.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is why I have never stopped praying for you since I heard about you. I ask God that you may know what He wants you to do. I ask God to fill you with the wisdom and understanding the Holy Spirit gives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then your lives will please the Lord. You will do every kind of good work, and you will know more about God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I pray that God’s great power will make you strong, and that you will have joy as you wait and do not give up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I pray that you will be giving thanks to the Father. He has made it so you could share the good things given to those who belong to Christ who are in the light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God took us out of a life of darkness. He has put us in the holy nation of His much-loved Son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We have been bought by His blood and made free. Our sins are forgiven through Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Christ is as God is. God cannot be seen. Christ lived before anything was made.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Christ made everything in the heavens and on the earth. He made everything that is seen and things that are not seen. He made all the powers of heaven. Everything was made by Him and for Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Christ was before all things. All things are held together by Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Christ is the head of the church which is His body. He is the beginning of all things. He is the first to be raised from the dead. He is to have first place in everything.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God the Father was pleased to have everything made perfect by Christ, His Son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everything in heaven and on earth can come to God because of Christ’s death on the cross. Christ’s blood has made peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At one time you were strangers to God and your minds were at war with Him. Your thoughts and actions were wrong.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Christ has brought you back to God by His death on the cross. In this way, Christ can bring you to God, holy and pure and without blame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is for you if you keep the faith. You must not change from what you believe now. You must not leave the hope of the Good News you received. The Good News was preached to you and to all the world. And I, Paul, am one of Christ’s missionaries.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now I am full of joy to be suffering for you. In my own body I am doing my share of what has to be done to make Christ’s sufferings complete. This is for His body which is the Church.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I became a preacher in His church for your good. In the plan of God I am to preach the Good News.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This great secret was hidden to the people of times past, but it is now made known to those who belong to Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God wants these great riches of the hidden truth to be made known to the people who are not Jews. The secret is this: Christ in you brings hope of all the great things to come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We preach Christ. We tell every man how he must live. We use wisdom in teaching every man. We do this so every man will be complete in Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the reason I am working. God’s great power is working in me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I want you to know how hard I have worked for you and for the Christians in the city of Laodicea and for those who have never seen me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: May their hearts be given comfort. May they be brought close together in Christian love. May they be rich in understanding and know God’s secret. It is Christ Himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In Christ are hidden all the riches of wisdom and understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you this so no one will try to change your mind with big sounding talk.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even if I am far away from you in body, I am with you in spirit. I am happy to learn how well you are getting along. It is good to hear that your faith is so strong in Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As you have put your trust in Christ Jesus the Lord to save you from the punishment of sin, now let Him lead you in every step.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Have your roots planted deep in Christ. Grow in Him. Get your strength from Him. Let Him make you strong in the faith as you have been taught. Your life should be full of thanks to Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be careful that no one changes your mind and faith by much learning and big sounding ideas. Those things are what men dream up. They are always trying to make new religions. These leave out Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Christ is not only God-like, He is God in human flesh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you have Christ, you are complete. He is the head over all leaders and powers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you became a Christian, you were set free from the sinful things of the world. This was not done by human hands. You were set free from the sins of your old self by what was done in Christ’s body.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you were baptized, you were buried as Christ was buried. When you were raised up in baptism, you were raised as Christ was raised. You were raised to a new life by putting your trust in God. It was God Who raised Jesus from the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you were dead in your sins, you were not set free from the sinful things of the world. But God forgave your sins and gave you new life through Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We had broken the Law many ways. Those sins were held against us by the Law. That Law had writings which said we were sinners. But now He has destroyed that writing by nailing it to the cross.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God took away the power of the leaders of this world and the powers of darkness. He showed them to the world. The battle was won over them through Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not let anyone tell you what you should or should not eat or drink. They have no right to say if it is right or wrong to eat certain foods or if you are to go to religious suppers. They have no right to say what you are to do at the time of the new moon or on the Day of Rest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These things are a picture of what is coming. The important thing is Christ Himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not let anyone rob you of your crown. They will try to get you to bow down in worship of angels. They think this shows you are not proud. They say they were told to do this in a dream. These people are proud because of their sinful minds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Such people are not a part of Christ. Christ is the Head. We Christians make up His body. We are joined together as a body is held together. Our strength to grow comes from Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have died with Christ and become dead to those old ways. Then why do you follow the old ways of worship? Why do you obey man-made rules?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These rules say, “You must not put your hand on this.” “Do not put this into your mouth.” “You must not put your finger on that.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All these things come to an end when they are used. You are following only man-made rules.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It looks as if it is wise to follow these rules in an act of worship, because they are hard on the body. It looks as if they are done without pride, but they are worth nothing. They do not take away a man’s desire to sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If then you have been raised with Christ, keep looking for the good things of heaven. This is where Christ is seated on the right side of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Keep your minds thinking about things in heaven. Do not think about things on the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are dead to the things of this world. Your new life is now hidden in God through Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Christ is our life. When He comes again, you will also be with Him to share His shining-greatness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Destroy the desires to sin that are in you. These desires are: sex sins, anything that is not clean, a desire for sex sins, and wanting something someone else has. This is worshiping a god.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is because of these sins that the anger of God comes down on those who do not obey Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You used to do these sins when you lived that kind of life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Put out of your life these things also: anger, bad temper, bad feelings toward others, talk that hurts people, speaking against God, and dirty talk.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not lie to each other. You have put out of your life your old ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have now become a new person and are always learning more about Christ. You are being made more like Christ. He is the One Who made you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There is no difference in men in this new life. Greeks and Jews are the same. The man who has gone through the religious act of becoming a Jew and the one who has not are the same. There is no difference between nations. Men who are servants and those who are free are the same. Christ is everything. He is in all of us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God has chosen you. You are holy and loved by Him. Because of this, your new life should be full of loving-pity. You should be kind to others and have no pride. Be gentle and be willing to wait for others.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Try to understand other people. Forgive each other. If you have something against someone, forgive him. That is the way the Lord forgave you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And to all these things, you must add love. Love holds everything and everybody together and makes all these good things perfect.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let the peace of Christ have power over your hearts. You were chosen as a part of His body. Always be thankful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let the teaching of Christ and His words keep on living in you. These make your lives rich and full of wisdom. Keep on teaching and helping each other. Sing the Songs of David and the church songs and the songs of heaven with hearts full of thanks to God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whatever you say or do, do it in the name of the Lord Jesus. Give thanks to God the Father through the Lord Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wives, obey your husbands. This is what the Lord wants you to do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Husbands, love your wives. Do not hold hard feelings against them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Children, obey your parents in everything. The Lord is pleased when you do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Fathers, do not be so hard on your children that they will give up trying to do what is right.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You who are servants who are owned by someone, obey your owners. Work hard for them all the time, not just when they are watching you. Work for them as you would for the Lord because you honor God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whatever work you do, do it with all your heart. Do it for the Lord and not for men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember that you will get your reward from the Lord. He will give you what you should receive. You are working for the Lord Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone does wrong, he will suffer for it. God does not respect one person more than another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Owners, give your servants what is right. Do the same for all. Remember that your Owner is in heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must keep praying. Keep watching! Be thankful always.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As you pray, be sure to pray for us also. Pray that God will open the door for us to preach the Word. We want to tell the secret of Christ. And this is the reason I am in prison.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pray that I will be able to preach so everyone can understand. This is the way I should speak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be wise in the way you live around those who are not Christians. Make good use of your time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Speak with them in such a way they will want to listen to you. Do not let your talk sound foolish. Know how to give the right answer to anyone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Tychicus will tell you how I am getting along. He is a much-loved brother and faithful helper. Both of us are owned by the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the reason I have sent him to you. It is so you can know about us. He can also bring joy to your hearts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Onesimus is going with Tychicus. He is one of your own people. He is faithful and we love him very much. They will tell you about everything here.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One of the men here in prison with me is Aristarchus. He says hello you. Mark, the cousin of Barnabas, says hello. (You have heard before that if he comes to you, you are to receive him and make him happy.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus Justus says hello also. These are the only Jewish workers helping me teach about the holy nation of God. What a help they have been to me!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Epaphras says hello. He is one of your people and a servant of Jesus Christ. As he prays for you, he asks God to help you to be strong and to make you perfect. He prays that you will know what God wants you to do in all things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I can tell you for sure that he works hard for you and for the Christians in the cities of Laodicea and Hierapolis.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Luke, the dear doctor, and Demas say hello.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Greet all the Christians in Laodicea. Greet Nympha and the Christians who gather for church in her house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When this letter has been read to you, have it read in the church in Laodicea also. Be sure you read the letter that is coming from Laodicea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Tell Archippus to be sure to finish the work the Lord called him to do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I, Paul, am writing this last part with my own hand. Do not forget that I am in prison. May you have God’s loving-favor.
verses.speaker: Narrator
